proceduralStep.title: B-Check Maintenance Task Overview
proceduralStep.para: This procedure describes the B-Check maintenance tasks to be performed at intervals of 4-6 months or 1,500-2,500 flight hours, whichever occurs first.
The B-Check typically takes 1-3 days and includes detailed inspections, lubrication tasks, and minor component replacements. All A-Check tasks are also included in the B-Check.

proceduralStep.title: Pre-Check Requirements
proceduralStep.para: Before beginning the B-Check, verify the following:

listItem.para: Aircraft is positioned in a maintenance hangar
Aircraft is properly grounded, secured, and on jacks if required
Work order has been generated in AAMMPP system
All required tools, materials, and spare parts are available
Qualified maintenance personnel and inspectors are assigned
All open discrepancies from previous checks have been reviewed

proceduralStep.title: Detailed Structural Inspections
proceduralStep.para: Perform detailed inspections of the following structural areas:

listItem.para: ATA-51: Structures - Detailed inspection of primary structure, including fastener torque checks
ATA-53: Fuselage - Detailed inspection of pressure bulkheads, frames, and skin panels
ATA-54: Nacelles/Pylons - Detailed inspection of engine mounts and attachment points
ATA-55: Stabilizers - Detailed inspection of stabilizer attachments and actuators
ATA-57: Wings - Detailed inspection of wing-body transition area (blended surfaces) and main spars

proceduralStep.title: Systems Detailed Inspections
proceduralStep.para: Perform detailed inspections of the following systems:

listItem.para: ATA-21: Air Conditioning - Inspect air conditioning packs, ducts, and controls
ATA-24: Electrical Power - Inspect generators, batteries, and distribution system
ATA-27: Flight Controls - Detailed inspection of actuators, linkages, and cables
ATA-29: Hydraulic Power - Detailed inspection of pumps, reservoirs, and lines
ATA-30: Ice and Rain Protection - Inspect anti-ice/de-ice systems
ATA-32: Landing Gear - Detailed inspection of gear, doors, and actuators
ATA-36: Pneumatic - Inspect pneumatic system components and ducting

proceduralStep.title: Lubrication and Servicing
proceduralStep.para: Complete the following lubrication and servicing tasks:

listItem.para: Lubricate all flight control hinges and bearings per maintenance manual
Lubricate landing gear components and trunnions
Lubricate door hinges and latches
Service hydraulic system and replace filters as required
Service air conditioning system and replace filters
Replace engine oil and oil filters per powerplant schedule

proceduralStep.title: Operational and Functional Tests
proceduralStep.para: Perform the following operational and functional tests:

listItem.para: ATA-22: Auto Flight - Test autopilot and flight director systems
ATA-27: Flight Controls - Rigging check and control surface travel verification
ATA-32: Landing Gear - Landing gear retraction/extension test with timing
ATA-34: Navigation - Test navigation systems and verify database currency
ATA-45: Central Maintenance - Download and analyze maintenance data

proceduralStep.title: Component Replacements
proceduralStep.para: Replace the following components per scheduled intervals:

listItem.para: Replace cabin air filters (ATA-21)
Replace hydraulic system filters (ATA-29)
Replace emergency equipment per life-limited requirements (ATA-25)
Replace any time-expired parts identified during inspection
Record all findings, measurements, and discrepancies in AAMMPP system
Complete all task cards with measurements and obtain required signatures
Update configuration records for all component changes
Update life-limited parts tracking system
Log environmental impact data including waste disposal (ESG reporting)
Generate inspection report and obtain Quality Assurance approval
Obtain return to service approval from authorized inspector
